review: I got this to watch selections of the 10,000 movies/TV programs that are available free with my PRIME membership and it does a fantastic job. The remote is nice and small and so doesn't take up much room, yet does a superb job of controlling the program. When not active, it displays a screen saver with some awesome photos of landscapes throughout the world. Very nice, though I wish they had a description of where the photo was taken. This unit does a lot more than what I'm using it for but with Amazon PRIME Instant I find I don't really need Netflix, Hulu or any of the other services. I do have TIVO and have for several years but TIVO can't do the free PRIME Instant movies/TV programs, only the paid ones.

review: Im just install my AFTV. Here are my opinions about it.Speed:  Excellent, more that my Roku 3, ATV3, and BDP 590Display: HDMI 1080p with a Sony Bravia (2103) TV, NO 24p frames.CEC: The AFTV has basic CEC. I can use the TV Remote to control play controls at it. BUT i cannot find equivalent HOME button  in the TV RemoteStorage:  8GB is to little... with basic apps I only has 4.35gb left (i didn't download any games yet)Subtitles:  On Netflix and Crackle are working...has to test on Hulu.Audio:  This is a Hot issue because before the AFTV, only Apple TV2/3 and pre 2013 Sony BluRays (so no ROKU no ChromeCast) had the options to decode and output Dolby Digital (NO PLUS). When i saw that this item was Dolby Digital certified I made the decision to buy it.  When I make the first installation earlier tonight I only receive Stereo...Checking the settings I saw a difference....the Amazon Fire TV CAN output Dolby Digital (5.1) ONLY via Toslink if you configure so in the setting>audio pane. This is important for many folks because older (but fully functioning) receivers cannot decode DD+Media Access: We know that Amazon wants that we consume their media products (films and tv shows) but I think that they make a pragmatic decision to make a box for Prime but without closing everything as Apple TV3.  We can use Plex, and the techies ones can install others media players also.For a price I can live with it, I hope that in future software updates we can have DLNA and maybe Dolby Digital on HDMI (as sony bdp/appletv)
